name: QP Semiconductor
overview: QP Semiconductor, Inc., a fabless semiconductor company, designs, manufactures, re-engineers, and provides integrated circuits for military and aerospace industries. It offers analog products ranging from op amps and comparators to voltage regulators; and logic products, including line drivers and receivers. The company also provides EPROM products to support various Hi Rel and military applications; FIFO products; microcontrollers; microprocessor and peripherals; programmable logic devices; BiPolar PROM products; CMOS PROM products; and SRAM products. In addition, it offers replacement hermetic parts for diminished manufacturing sources and end of life products. The company sells its products through representatives and distributors in North America, France, Belgium, Spain, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Hong Kong, India, Italy, Israel, Japan, Turkey, the United Kingdom, and Ireland. QP Semiconductor, Inc. was formerly known as QP Labs, Inc. and changed its name to QP Semiconductor, Inc. in 2003. The company was founded in 1985 and is headquartered in Santa Clara, California. The company has internal test and burn-in facility in Santa Clara, California; and Bangkok, Thailand, as well as sales locations in the Eastern and Western United States, British Columbia, Canada, Europe, and Asia. As of October 10, 2008, QP Semiconductor, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of e2v Technologies plc.
